Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Allegheny County Health Department and U.S. Department of Justice have reached a settlement agreement with Allegheny Ludlum Corp. (ALC) for alleged Clean Air Act violations at ALC's Natrona silicon steel production plant in Allegheny County, Pa.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/8c8ba82225536e5c8525772600711fec.html
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Description: A federal district court ordered Allegheny Ludlum Steel Corporation to pay $8,244,670 for violations of the Clean Water Act at its steel mills on the Allegheny and Kiskimenetas Rivers outside Pittsburgh.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2002/February/02_enrd_099.htm

Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Description: Oregon Metallurgical of Albany, Ore. and TDY Industries of Millersburg, Ore. have agreed to pay a combined total of $825,000 in civil penalties to resolve alleged violations related to improper storage, transportation, and disposal of anhydrous magnesium chloride, a reactive hazardous waste that can pose serious fire and explosion threats.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/846ee4bdd3cee30d85257c4400829da2.html
